name: RemotePowerShell
description: Execute PowerShell commands remotely on machine(s)
author: Microsoft Corporation

inputs.name: MachineNames
inputs.label: Deploy to Machines
inputs.helpMarkDown: Comma-separated list of machine names (IP address/fqdn). For example, BudgetIT-Web01, BudgetIT-Web02.

inputs.name: Port
inputs.label: Powershell port
inputs.helpMarkDown: Powershell port of the machine. Default port is 5986 for HTTPS, 5985 for HTTP

inputs.name: MachineUsername
inputs.label: Username
inputs.helpMarkDown: Admin username for the machines specified.

inputs.name: MachinePassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Password corresponding to the admin username for the machines.

inputs.name: SourcePackage
inputs.label: Source
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the application binaries. Variables like $(Build.Repository.LocalPath) can be used for binaries in the Automation Agent. For example, $(Build.Repository.LocalPath)\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: ApplicationPath
inputs.label: Destination
inputs.helpMarkDown: Local Path on target machines for copying the binaries from the source. For example, C:\BudgetIT\Web.

inputs.name: ScriptPath
inputs.label: PowerShell Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell script on the local machine or on a UNC path. For example, C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\Website.ps1

inputs.name: InitializationScriptPath
inputs.label: Initialization Script
inputs.helpMarkDown: Location of the PowerShell initialization script (Data script for DSC) on the local machine or on a UNC path. For example, C:\BudgetIT\Web\Deploy\WebsiteConfiguration.ps1
